description:
In a remote town where adventurers gather, the annual "Fighting Tournament" is about to be held.
The rules of this year's tournament are tag-team battles.
The adventurers are trying to decide who will be their partner in order to win the tournament.

Each team takes turns to play their turn.
The winner is the team that eliminates both of the enemy team's characters from combat.

Escape: The Curse of the Temple is a cooperative game in which players must escape (yes...) from a temple (yes...) which is cursed (yes...) before the temple collapses and kills one or more explorers, thereby causing everyone to lose.

Escape is played in real-time, with all players rolling dice and taking actions simultaneously. You must roll the right symbols to enter a room, and if you're at an open doorway, you can roll to reveal the next tile in the stack and add it to that doorway. Some rooms contain combinations of red and blue symbols, and if you (possibly working with other players in the same room) roll enough red or blue symbols, you "discover" magic gems, moving them from a separate gem depot onto that tile.

The family box comes with the 2 modules found in the original base game (Treasures and Curses) plus 7 Queenies (The Pit, Doomed, The Fountain, Quest Chambers, The Maze, The Dungeon, and The Maya Calendar)

Spend your morning creating beautiful pottery at your local ceramics studio. Mold clay, apply glaze, and fire up the kiln to create objects that are both wonderful to look at and fit for purpose.

Over the course of Sunrise at the Studio, players simultaneously draft clay, glaze, and kiln resources to complete the various pottery projects in front of them.

Get ready to spend your morning creating beautiful pottery at your local ceramics studio!

Set up to play in a few minutes as you prepare studio challenges, projects, and your work area.

Experience the fun of working with clay as you chose how to use your resources!

What kind of work style will you choose? Find the right mix as you consider which resources to use... And which to pass.

Use resource cubes to mark your progress! Complete delightful projects and intricate showpieces.

See who created their next masterpiece! Pick up new projects to work on, find fun bonuses on advantage cards, and declare your pottery prowess with studio challenges.

After 3 days, admire the works you created, then see who scored the most points!

-description from publisher

Kao the Kangaroo is an adventure board game for the whole family. Take on the role of the jumping Kao the Kangaroo and traverse abstract worlds familiar to fans of the video game.

Build the board by adding new tiles and move your Kangaroo collecting precious coins, treasures and cards. Jump on them and collect valuable coins, treasures in chests and cards. The player who collected most coins and oponent cards will be the winner.

Be careful! Opponents can cross your plans, so be sure bravely and cleverly overcome any diversity. You can use Challenge Cards to slow down other players and jump after jump get closer to victory!

A modular game board consisting of 37 tiles from places known from the video game!
Dynamic gameplay that shows you to take action during another player’s turn!
The simple mechanics of the platform game will provide hours of entertainment for the whole family!

—description from the publisher

An escape room game where you're trying to find captain Aamos Uutos' greatest treasure.

Aamos Uutos sailed lake Saimaa for decades, and you have the keys to his greatest treasure in your hands. You only need to solve his puzzles to find out what the treasure really is.

Aye, Dark Overlord! is a fantasy party game filled with humor that's fast to play and easy to learn.

Each player is an evil goblin servant of the evil Dark Overlord — Rigor Mortis, the Master of all Evils — and all of them are gathered at the Dark Overlord's knees to explain why they brought that last important mission, ordered by "His Evil Excellence" himself, to failure again. Panic wraps you in its freezing grip; what can you do to save your poor skin? Could you say you are not the one to blame, but your inept companions? Yes, of course, that's the solution! There is only one little problem: They've probably got exactly the same idea...and the Dark Overlord is not known for his mercy...

This roleplaying game is all about telling lies and shifting the blame on your poor fellow ones, so the righteous wrath of your Master can give them what they deserve!

Aye, Dark Overlord! Luxastra is a new version of Aye, Dark Overlord! that is playable on its own while also capable of being combined with the original game (red and/or green box).

				
				
					==============================================Ciò che non sarà salvato, sarà purgato!

Mille fuochi fatui si illuminano, quando fai ritorno nella sala del Trono Profano dopo un’altra missione andata male. Il Sovrano Piumato, primo fra i sette Dèi Antichi, non ne sarà certo compiaciuto! Presto sarai dinanzi al Suo cospetto, ed Egli ti interrogherà su questo ennesimo fallimento.

Che fare per conservare integra la pellaccia? Magari potresti raccontargli che la colpa non è tua, ma di quegli imbecilli dei tuoi compari? Ma sì, certo! Ecco la soluzione! C’è un solo, piccolo problema: la stessa cosa sarà venuta in mente anche a loro.

Racconta panzane! Scarica la Colpa! Salvati dalla delusione senza pietà del Re Corvo! Fa il suo grande ritorno Sì, Oscuro Signore, party game dal tono scanzonato e umoristico, questa volta in salsa Luxastra: l’amatissima campagna di gioco di ruolo in streaming su YouTube del gruppo di InnTale. Veloce da imparare e facile da giocare, per Sì Oscuro Signore – Luxastra sono sufficienti alcuni amici e un po’ di fantasia. Gli incompetenti e inetti servitori del Re Corvo, Dio antico dalle motivazioni imperscrutabili, dovranno giustificarsi davanti al loro Signore, inventando storie improbabili e scaricando la colpa sui loro compagni di sventura.

Sì, Oscuro Signore! Luxastra è un  gioco completo che può essere giocato singolarmente oppure può essere combinato in un unico grande gioco con il set rosso e verde di Sì, Oscuro Signore. Contiene nuovi modi di scaricare la colpa e un’enorme quantità di nuove e bellissime carte spunto.

Lebbod is  a strategical dice game, where you you try to be the first player that collects 3 pieces of a world wonder.
You do this by moving your tiles, based on the numbers you rolled. 
When you land on another player’s tile, you remove their tile from the board. The first to remove 4 tiles gets a piece of a world wonder.

Droggel was included as a bonus in the first edition of the video game The Whispered World. It consists of a game board and three twelve-sided dice that show Nordic runes instead of numbers. In addition, you need to provide one playing piece for each player.

The players race to the finish space. The player who reaches it first wins. During your turn, you roll the three runic dice and spend them on three possible actions:
Move: If a die shows the rune of an adjacent space, you may spend the die to move to that space.
Jump: If a die shows the rune of an adjacent space, and the color of that space matches the color of the die, you may spend the die to jump over that space to the next space with a matching rune.
Droggel: If multiple dice show the same rune, you may move directly to the next space showing that rune. No dice are spent during a Droggel. After a Droggel, you reroll all of your remaining dice.

If you move to a space that is already occupied by another player, you fight over that space. Fights are resolved using a simple dice-based combat mechanism. The loser of the fight has to move their piece one or more spaces backwards.

Central Park, 1925: As part of a squirrel gang, you must smuggle in your illegal nut cargo, hide from customs officers, protect your loot, and prepare for potential police raids!

In Nutty Business, players start with symmetrical hands of cards. Each round, they add a card on one of the two piles in front of them and activate the effect on top of each pile. Card effects involve hoarding nuts, stealing from opponents, and disturbing their plans. Once someone has played out their whole hand, the player with the most nuts wins.

Even with only eight action cards, the game is surprisingly complex thanks to the variety of combinations and table dynamics to analyze.

—description from the publisher

Miezi & Mopsie is about placing 4-in-a-row cat or dogs discs on a variable playing grid out of cards. It's a game of cats (Miezis) against dogs (Mopsies). Each player has to place 4 of his discs in a row, possibly in multiple places or in rows longer than 4. Depending on certain conditions on neighboring/underlying grid fields, cat discs can be stolen (removed by the opponent), and dog discs may award bonus points at the end of the game.

—user summary

Each player plays as a figurine collector who is looking to manipulate the market to ensure that their figurines are the most valuable.

Each round players will simultaneously select a figurine from their collection to add to the market (which is a pyramid). In market order they will place the figures into the market, if they can be played legally as there are some restrictions on placement.

The round continues until the market is full and points are scored for figures left in a player's collection based on the position in the market. Play continues for 3 rounds with the player with the most points at the end winning.

Trick-taking x Bingo x Retro Cafe

"Bid prediction" hit and get points. In addition, you can get a bonus by "achieving the goal"! And grab the victory with "Bingo established"!

Fashionable cute designs and themes. However, the appearance is sweet, but the game is not...! ?

It's party time in the jungle and all the animals have scattered. Now you have to straighten them out!
It's like a game of tangram where you arrange the tiles to replicate the shapes on the game cards and earn as many points as you can.

—description from the publisher

In the seasonal trick-taking game Holly Oak, 3-5 revelers mark the passing of the seasons, seeking the favor of the Celtic Oak and Holly kings, locked in their endless cycle of growth, decay, and renewal.

You must follow the current season if you can, but if you can't, then you may play any card. If you play a card of the next season, the season changes!

A change in season often alters who wins that trick, as the highest rank card of the season that the trick ends in, wins that trick. These potential mid-trick season changes means that standard trick-taking maneuvers, such as drawing out trump, often won't work.

Players score points either by taking the 6 Holly and Oak kings, worth 1 or 2 points each, or by taking no tricks at all, worth 8, 5, or 3 points in 3, 4, and 5 player games respectively.

Between no-trick scoring and mid-trick trump changes, Holly Oak becomes a game of manipulating both the lead and current season to your advantage. Can you master the changing seasons?

Set in the Age of Piracy, the European kingdoms are fighting each others for the possession of the richest ports in the Antilles. Their best preferred weapons are the guns of their fleets, the gold of their governors, the force of local militias, the power of the Church and the cunning of their spies. They will try to overcome the enemy governors and seize their gold.
Doblòn is a card game with easy rules and fast play, with a fixed number of turns.
At the end of the last round, the player who earned or seized the most doubloons is the winner.

—description from the publisher

A group of adventurers are reminiscing about their past exploits. Things soon get heated, and everyone’s memories are getting fuzzier and fuzzier… Can you pull yours together and tell the most glorious story? Don’t let sticking to the absolute truth keep you out of the spotlight because, after all… you’re the one who deserves to go down in history!

Earn glory by linking your memories intelligently with the other players’ memories. The player with the most glory at the end of the game wins! Each memory will work more or less well with the other memories and will reveal its storytelling potential if its installation conditions are met. It’s up to you to make your memories fit in as well as possible, right up to the very end of the story!

Your mining company has found rich ore on this small moon, but you need buyers. Connect your mine to all 3 surface settlements, and hire squads to defend your mine and attack your rival.

Moon Squad is a connection game in the family of Hex and Y. It includes a capturing mechanism which adds drama and dynamic positional play. It also incentivizes players to deviate from standard connection game tactics. Moon Squad was inspired by Christian Freeling's Knightvision.

—description from the publisher

This is a game where you make your debut as a rookie Vtuber and aim for 1 million subscribers. Earn money while increasing your subscribers and do a lot of distribution. Don't forget to sabotage your rivals by extracting registrants from time to time.
—description from the designer (translated)

In Liar/Liver you will be choosing to roll 1 or 2 dice and then depending on the result activating your own or other players Delivery cards (Machi Koro style.) your character has a persistent power that will activate on a double as you try and balance followers and gold. first to 100 Followers (1 million) wins.

—user summary

You are a witch in the stock market and you must use your magic and ingenuity to obtain more money than your opponents.

Witch Market is a no language dependent, family-friendly filler where players must buy or sell ingredients from the market at the most opportune times.

Buy: To take all the ingredients of the same color from the market for Free! You know... using magic.

Sell: Discard from your hand all the Ingredientes of the same color and get coins for them! This is how you win!

The value of each sold Ingredient will be equal to the number of ingredients of the same type sold on the Market! So plan your sales wisely.

Get rewards for being one of the fastest sellers! Sometimes selling first is better than selling a lot, so time your sales to get coin rewards.

But don't be greedy! At the end of the game, each ingredient that is still in your hand will subtract 2 coins! So try to take the necessary Ingredients and sell them in time.

Witch Market is a game of 20 minutes, where each movement will modify the Market and the decisions of all the witches.
Can you be the wealthiest witch? Or will your greed win you over?

—description from the designer

A dynamic game where chips are moving all the time creating fascinating bee hives!

The game accurately simulates a real life beehive. The player is given a starter beehive and must plan strategically and manage the hive's resources, bee production, comb space and stores to grow the hive as strong as possible. The players must endure a chaotic and ever changing environment that is uncertain, but somewhat governed by the different seasons, diseases and man-made events.

The purpose of the game is to grow the hive and to accumulate as many SWARMS as possible without letting the hive die of starvation or run out of bees.  Bee biology and seasons knowledge will give the players an edge but luck also helps.

—description from the designer

Wizcape Academy is an escape game that mixes puzzles, narrative and technology, immersing you in a magical world. An envelope full of enigmas and magical elements will come to your hands. You will have to use your wits to solve all the puzzles, pass the tests and join the magic academy.

In this new adventure, you will have to use your magical power and test all your senses to pass the entrance exam to the magic academy. Will you be able to perform the spells and prepare the potions correctly?

—description from the publisher

Finta is a drawless connection game for two players: Red and Blue. It is played on a square grid of dots arranged in rows and columns. The dots on the first and last rows are connected to their neighbors on the same row with horizontal red lines, and the dots on the first and last columns are connected to their neighbors on the same column with vertical blue lines.

Red plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, connect with a straight line of your color two orthogonally or diagonally adjacent dots that are not yet connected with a straight line. Lines and chains of lines of different colors may touch but must not intersect. A chain of lines of the same color may intersect itself, on a dot or elsewhere.

You win by completing a chain of lines of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, Blue will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Red instead of making a regular move.

—description from the designer

Cablink is a drawless connection game for two players: Red and Blue. It is played on a square grid of dots arranged in rows and columns. The dots on the first and last rows are connected to their neighbors on the same row with horizontal red lines, and the dots on the first and last columns are connected to their neighbors on the same column with vertical blue lines.

Red plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, you may connect with a straight line of your color two orthogonally adjacent dots that are not yet connected with a straight line.

Alternatively, if two parallel red lines and two parallel blue lines form a minimal square with dots as vertices, you may connect the midpoints of your two lines in the set with a straight line of your color, as long as the two enemy lines in the set are not yet connected with such a line.

Chains of lines of different colors may touch but must not intersect. A chain of lines of the same color may intersect itself.

You win by completing a chain of lines of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, Blue will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Red instead of making a regular move.

—description from the designer

Be a market vendor in Bansan, a lively game inspired by the  multisensory experience of a bustling wet market in Penang. You'll need to "bao ka liao"—deal with fellow vendors, wholesalers, and customers; buy and sell ingredients; cook and serve hawker stall fare; keep the waste bins from overflowing; and navigate a myriad of events that changes up every game you play.

Each player is a vendor renting market stalls while running a hawker food business in a bansan. On your turn, you will stock produce from the wholesale supply into market stalls, then take 2 actions from 3 options:


     BUY produce from other vendors or your wholesaler
     SELL produce to online customers
     EMPTY a waste bin 


Just like in local Asian markets, bargain at anytime to negotiate the best deals from other vendors. Then complete shopping lists of ingredients to make a variety of hawker food for your customers. The vendor who has earned the most money at game end wins!

There's also the Sendiri Mode - a solo way to play Bansan, and the Kenduri Mode - when the market gets a big order to host a feast!

Juggle the multiple roles of a vendor to win the title of "Bos Bansan!" Even if you get out-vended, you are guaranteed a taste of the chaos and excitement of local market culture in Malaysia!

—description from the designer

Support shops and facilities to develop your village! A mid-level board game from the Worker Placement x Set Collection!

This is the La Toro region where two tribes live, the Uka and the Suma.
As a member of the Uka tribe, you will do your best to develop the village.
Collect resources well and support shops and facilities to contribute to the development of the village and become the best clan.

A board game of worker placement x set collection by Sui Works x Kame's tag team!
In a short time of 4 rounds, you can enjoy a dense interaction with the advanced elements of worker placement!
The essence of Fuki, who has created rich games, can be felt throughout the game!

The Collapse is a wargame that will be published in Spanish and English, which has a point-to-point mechanic for 2 players (with an optional multiplayer rule up to 6 players) with a common deck (CDG), depicting the epic campaigns of the Thirty Years' War in Europe between 1618 and 1648. Each player takes on the role of a faction (Imperial or Protestant), seeking to direct the fate of the "Holy Roman German Empire" while pursuing their own national interests, allowing to reproduce bold moves and influence or control regions in the Holy Roman Empire, Flanders and the United Provinces, Northern Italy and Hungary. With the crucial support of foreign nations both military (troops) and with 'Subsidies' (financial resources) will help to achieve victory for one of the two game’ factions.

The game will include a historical and scenarios book with very interesting historical information about the conflict, and 9 scenarios with different duration (from 2 to 10 turns the full 30 years' war campaign scenario), and also 2 scenarios specially designed to learn the game mechanics from less to more difficult and game strategies.

The Collapse is an intense and very fun game, which is easy to play due to its main mechanics (point to point) and being a card engine (CDG), but with unique aspects such as the planning phase at the beginning of the turn, the prestige points that grant more options to the players (leaders, unique capabilities and much more), and the intense but impressive diplomacy of 9 nations and alliances (Saxony, Brandenburg, England, Papacy, Hungary, Spain, Denmark, Sweden and France). With the recommended optional rule that players can go one more turn with some modifiers if they want to continue playing once the scenario is over and they are having fun.

Each card has Operations Points (OPS), which allow you to play the card for Operations and/or the event by paying its cost from the OPS of the card, giving many different game options and strategies.

The different Operations that players can use with their operation points are Deploy, Movement (with the option to perform minor or major battles reflecting the unique nature of the conflict and the strategic options for you to decide how to invest your limited resources), Diplomacy, Naval Blockade, Siege and Replacements. The tension of the game will be increased by having players loot regions and fortresses to pay their units (the 30 years’ war was devastating and troops were frequently fed and paid with what was ravaged. And be careful not to pay the mercenaries in the game, because they can add revolts to the game!

The sequence of each game turn is divided into 4 main phases:


     Planning phase: depending on the prestige of each faction, various actions of the factions may have more or less options
     Campaign phase: players alternate cards from their hand (6 cards per turn)
     End of Turn Phase: where players use their replacement points to strengthen their troops and armies, determine possible attrition of units outside of their home regions, observe possible expansion of revolts, redeploy units to prepare for the next turn (campaign) and extra victory points can be earned for certain conditions.
     Victory Check phase: where at the end of each scenario the victory is checked. There is also the option for an automatic game victory.


—description from the publisher

In Stairs to Kiss, the players play a climbing game about watching a couple go through the first 9 of Sachiko Takahashi's 12 Stages of Intimacy.

The first player to play all of the cards from their hand wins.

In ãƒŸãƒ©ãƒ†ãƒ« - Miracle Cocktail, players opened each their own bar in a city renown for its magical cocktails. They will compete to become the most popular bar in town, by obtaining the most popularity points.

Each round, magical ingredients are poured one next to the other from a magical cocktail shaker. Players will then have to choose a group of 3 contiguous ingredients, which will fill different storage bottles or even generate coins, depending on their amount and nature. Storing enough of these components or using them to create cocktail recipes will generate special actions, additional ingredients, coins, and popularity. Combos can be created in the process.

After 8 rounds, popularity points are tallied for every player and whoever has the most wins.

—user summary

In late 1686, Sir William Phipps convinced investors to fund an expedition to what is now Haiti and the Dominican Republic to find sunken treasure, despite the location of the shipwreck being based entirely on rumor and speculation. In January 1687, Phipps found the wreck of the Spanish galleon Nuestra Señora de la Concepción off the coast of Santo Domingo. Some sources say they used an inverted container for the salvage operation while others say the crew was assisted by Indian divers in the shallow waters. The operation lasted from February to April 1687 during which time they salvaged jewels, some gold and 30 tons of silver which, at the time, was worth over £200,000.

Diving Bell takes the players on a journey to the bottom of the sea to find various treasures. But it is not a walk in the park to find them - various threats exist to stop the players from doing so. 
Diving Bell is a cooperative game that players will use a unique way of choosing actions to get their ships ready for diving. A diving bell is also an option to help with the success of each dive they are used. Spatial thinking, action selection,  resource management, and other mechanisms are available for the players who wish to conquer the deep.

—description from the designer

In the game of "cross roads" each player becomes one of the builders of a "town".  The center of the Playing Board is a map of the Blocks and Crossroads of this "town".  The Blocks are divided into square lots and are zoned in color as to the type of buildings or landscaping that is permitted on each lot.  The "town" is divided into two, three or four lot Blocks.

The object of the game is to be the player with the highest total of bonus money when the game ends.

—user summary

You parked your drakkar at the beach as best you could. Now you need to hurry up, find the ring you lost, and take it to your significant other waiting for you at the top of the mountain.
Along the way you may meet a dragon, which you love cooked in the oven with asparagus, and decide to kill it.

To play, you will need a pencil and three 6-sided dice.
Explore the map and collect power-ups to become stronger and defeat the enemies you encounter.
You can use these upgrades to increase your Fighting skill or increase your Hit points.
Keep track of your characteristics by checking the boxes on your character sheet.
When you encounter enemies and have to fight, roll the dice, modify the result thanks to your special Fighting ability and compare the result with the values indicated next to the enemy; if the result is equal or greater you have won and can continue the mission.

To win you must find the ring and take it to the top of the mountain.

Contestants, wrap your hands and put on your gloves! Everything is prepared and the round-one bell rings. The crowd is full of excitement and expects nothing less than your strongest punches! Are you ready to become the best fighter in the ring?

In this set-collection game, players will battle each other, comparing the strength of their fighters' punches! The player with the strongest team will add the fighter cards to their Hall of Fame. Then, both teams will be replaced with new cards. These blow-for-blow battles will continue until someone lands the winning punch by fulfilling one of the win conditions. This will immediately end the game, granting that player the champion's title!

—description from the publisher

Populate the coral reef with your anemones and fill it with color. If you have more than anyone else at the end of the game, you’ll be the winner!

In Anemone, your goal is to have more anemones on the reef than anyone else.

On your turn, draw the top card of the deck and play it following the rules below.

All cards are composed of 3 different figures in all 3 possible colors.

Always play new cards partially or completely on top of the cards already at the center of the table (the reef):

     If you place it partially (one or two sections of the card), you must match at least one color on the cards it is being placed upon.
     If you place it completely, you must match two colors on the cards it is placed upon.


—description from the publisher

Travel through space to seek out elements that will let you go back home safely. Face enemies you meet and do not lose your route using the special warp drive.

To play, you will need a pencil and three 6-sided dice.
Explore the map and collect power-ups to become stronger and defeat the enemies you encounter.
You can use these upgrades to increase your Precision skill or your Survival skill.
Keep track of your characteristics by checking the boxes on your character sheet.
When you encounter enemies and have to fight, roll the dice, modify the result thanks to your special ability Accuracy and compare the result with the values indicated next to the enemy; if the result is equal or greater you have won and can continue the mission.

To win, you must collect the 4 elements scattered around the map and return them to their respective spaceports. Once they are all in place you can access the route to your planet and win the game.

—description from the designer

The night is your friend. The shadows are your shelter.Move quietly and avoid useless fights. Find your prey and complete your mission.

To play, you'll need a pencil and a 6-sided die. Walk the paths and look for the power-ups you meet along the way.
You can use these upgrades to increase your Hide skill or your Fight skill.
Keep track of your characteristics by checking the boxes on your character sheet.
When you meet enemies and have to fight roll the dice, modify the result thanks to your special abilities and compare the result with the values indicated next to the enemy; if the result is equal or greater you have won and can continue the mission.
To win you must reach the temple and defeat the final boss.

—description from the designer

In 4 Pints, you will visit a typical English pub for a nice pint of beer. Each turn, one of you will go to the bar, where four pints await you. 
To buy them, you must first scratch your pockets looking for a few pounds but you must be careful to control your drunkenness level and avoid elbowing and slipping. The walk to the bar can be quite an adventure!

A game lasts as many rounds as the number of players. Starting with the first player, each round, players play consecutive turns until the deck of Beer cards is exhausted and all players have played the same number of turns. Your turn has 2 steps:


     Reveal Purchase cards: you must reveal Purchase cards one by one from the deck and place them at the center of the table. You must draw at least 1 card and you can draw as many as you want until you collect enough money to buy a pint you like from the bar, or until you decide to pass. Each time you draw a card, add its value to your total if it is a Money card, and apply its effect if it is an Event card.
     Buy 1 pint or pass: you can only buy 1 Beer per turn and you must pay its full price with the Money cards accumulated during your turn at the center of the table and/or your game area. When you buy a pint, place the card upright (unspilled) in your game area, in full view of the other players. If you don't want to buy anything or don't want to risk it with the Purchase cards, you may pass and end your turn.


—description from the publisher

Lone Sherman puts you in charge of a single Sherman Tank and its crew somewhere in France in World War II, and tasks you with navigating your Sherman through varied and challenging Missions. Whilst this game is not a ‘narrative driven’ game as such, with a little imagination it will provide memorable stories. The Missions allow the Player to invent any kind of back-story they like in order to enhance the feel of the game. Some events are randomly generated, but the Player always has at least some degree of control over the level of risk they wish to take and how vulnerable they leave their Tank to these Events.

The Fields of Normandy 2 (the sequel to The Fields of Normandy) is set in Normandy, France in 1944 and reflects loosely the conditions and situations faced by the US VIII Corps of the United States Army as it pushed inland as part of Operation Cobra. The fighting was intense and incredibly violent. German units were very well dug in and protected by artillery and mines. In the game, you will be controlling small groups of soldiers from a platoon, consisting of three Rifle Squads, a Machine Gun Team, a Bazooka Team and a Mortar Team. As the platoon Lieutenant, it is your job to command these squads and teams in order to clear the German defensive positions.

The aim of this book is to present two clear, accessible, and quick to learn war games, so that players can get into the action quickly. It does not try to replace more complex wargames which often take many hours to learn and to play. Each of the Missions can be played in around an hour and the game provides plenty of 'replayability'.

This games in this book are solitaire hex and counter style wargame. You play the games, and the enemies are controlled by the game book (or the Artificial Intelligence or ‘AI’). You will need to bring at least 5, but preferably 7, standard six-sided dice. Full colour 'Mission Maps' are included. Methods to play the game include:

     Cut out or copy the counters provided on the final page of the book, stick them to card and cut them out with a good quality craft knife or pair of scissors.
     Photocopy the maps and draw/write on the pages lightly in pencil and erase when necessary. You can use any annotations you choose for the units, that make sense to you.
     Lay the book flat (it’s well-bound, it can stand it!) and use cubes, miniatures, or similar tokens for the units.
     Use some kind of acetate and dry-wipe markers.


Take a photo of the maps on a tablet and use the “edit” function to draw and erase.

Nice to Know: Animals is a 1-6 players wildly competitive entertaining card game that aims to provide unique facts about the animals. It's the first game in the "Nice to Know" series

In this game, each player becomes a zoologist on a mission to study different animal species. You'll earn points by researching animals, completing secret quests, and preparing for the epic endgame scoring.

The game flow is simple and allows for various strategies. Here's how it goes down:


     Draw your secret quests
     Gain research points
     Travel the world by paying the cost or using the sponsor flights
     Research animals


But wait, there's more! As you strive to win the game, you'll also stumble upon the most unique animal facts you've ever encountered. Who knew that sloths have secret dance parties when no one's looking? Or that penguins enjoy listening to heavy metal music? Well, not those ones but real ones. Get ready to have your mind blown with every quest completion!

Oh, and for all you solo players out there, we've got something extra special. Introducing our "Artificial Animal" (AA)! Solo play just got a whole lot wilder with five levels of difficulty. Brace yourself for the wackiest animal encounters you can imagine!

With a whopping 82 different animal species and a total of 182 animal cards, you'll never run out of outrageous information. And believe us, these animal facts are a rollercoaster of emotions. One moment you'll be laughing , and the next, you'll be shedding a tear... Get ready for a wild and emotional animal-filled adventure!

Nice to Know: Animals is more than just a game; it's a funny journey into the animal kingdom. So gather your friends and family, embrace your inner zoologist, and get ready to learn, laugh, and have a blast like never before!

description from the publisher

Wow! You just found a strange high-tech device that looks like a phone... but it's much more interesting. It has an incredible collection of DinoBits, digital dinosaurs that can be projected in 3D holograms! Gather your friends and family and discover which are the longest, heaviest, tallest or oldest dinosaurs.

DinoLore it's a kids game that adults will also enjoy. During the game, players will take turns challenging the rest of the players: «My Stegosaurus is the longest! ». The other players can accept the challenge if they think they have a longest dinosaur in their hand and try to win all the cards played.

Compare dinosaurs and build the biggest collection of DinoBits!
Wow! You just found a strange high-tech device that looks like a phone... but it's much more interesting. It has an incredible collection of DinoBits, digital dinosaurs that can be projected in 3D holograms! Gather your friends and family and discover which are the longest, heaviest, tallest or oldest dinosaurs.

DinoLore it's a kids game that adults will also enjoy. During the game, players will take turns challenging the rest of the players: «My Stegosaurus is the longest! ». The other players can accept the challenge if they think they have a longest dinosaur in their hand and try to win all the cards played.

Compare dinosaurs and build the biggest collection of DinoBits!
Wow! You just found a strange high-tech device that looks like a phone... but it's much more interesting. It has an incredible collection of DinoBits, digital dinosaurs that can be projected in 3D holograms! Gather your friends and family and discover which are the longest, heaviest, tallest or oldest dinosaurs.

DinoLore it's a kids game that adults will also enjoy. During the game, players will take turns challenging the rest of the players: «My Stegosaurus is the longest! ». The other players can accept the challenge if they think they have a longer dinosaur in their hand and try to win all the cards played.

Compare dinosaurs and build the biggest collection of DinoBits!

The washing machine has gone crazy and wants to destroy all socks! Terrified by the situation, all the socks have run away, but in the midst of the chaos everyone has lost their family and friends.

In Apocalipsocks you'll have to help the socks find their pair, the only issue is that all of them are very similar. Beat the other players finding the pairs of socks the fastest, activate their special powers and become the great hero that stopped the Apocalipsocks.

"Route 66: Get Your Tricks" is a trick-taking card game for two players.

Enjoy the adventure of taking a road trip. Travel West along America's Main Street, stopping along roadside destinations and navigating Interstate Highways. This nostalgic twist on traditional European card games puts you right in the driver's seat.

The game is played over a series of rounds where players race to travel 66 miles. Depending on how well players pace their trip by winning rounds, they may be able to travel 1-3 states per round.

Greater rewards can be risked by closing the road. But choose your destinations carefully. If you fall behind, you'll have to rely on the dashboard warning lights to get you back up to speed. The first player to travel from Illinois to California wins the game!

Cayley HamiDElton is a competitive game about accounting shenanigans, as you try to report a lower income in order to pay less taxes, but could get caught.

The game consists of a deck of cards which show your profits on one side and the potential fine on the other. In a round, each player puts out one card, profit side down, and the players have an auction of decreasing bids, to declare how low of a profit you're willing to claim.

Once there is only one person left, they take on the title of accountant, and slowly reveal the cards everyone played.  If the sum is less than the declared amount, everyone takes their own card as points and the accountant also takes a bonus card. If the sum is more, the accountant takes all excess cards as penalties.

The person with the most points at the end of the game wins.

In the five centuries since the Wound was closed, the kingdoms of Kalar have struggled to rebuild their shattered societies. A resurgent Empire spread across the great sea, bringing civilization to the untamed eastern continent of Kheros. But Lilith, one of the immortal sorcerers responsible for the Worldwound, arrived first, preparing the way for the return of her dark mistress. For nearly six hundred years she has plotted and schemed. In 588 (2023 Gregorian), the wait is over.

Burning Banners: Rage of the Witch Queen is a fantasy wargame for two to six players. Fast playing and intuitive, a whopping 29 scenarios range from short campaigns with 2 Kingdoms and one map, to the entire 12-year war, in which 6 kingdoms battle over four maps. The rules include a quick-playing Basic Game as well as an Advanced Game which introduces Magic, Heroes, and Monsters guarding powerful treasures.

March 1” Armies and Heroes through huge, lovingly detailed hexes. Explore a vast, detailed fantasy world encompassing four mounted game maps with six unique kingdoms and dozens of troop types. Designed and illustrated by acclaimed fantasy artist, Christopher Moeller!

—description from the publisher

Towards Guy Alley Card Game is a trick-taking game where players will play some of their cards twice. Specifically, the winner of each trick will take their own card as points, but the losers will place their cards face down in a special stack.  Once a player is out of cards, they pick up the cards they lost with, turn them over to a different rank range, and continue playing.

At the start of the round, players bid for how many points (not tricks) they will take. These bids must be formed by the sum of two cards, numbered 0 to 7.  A player also has the opportunity to play one of these two bid cards to a trick.

Players earn points for hitting their bid exactly and will otherwise lose points. The person with the most points after a number of rounds wins.

First off, I should point out that "meatgrinder" is being used in professional literature about the battle.  An example is the 18th April 2023 article "How Long Should Ukrainian Forces Defend Bakhmut? Lessons from Stalingrad," by Gælan Hanlon on West Point's Modern War Institute website.

This seemingly conventional hex-and-counter combat-odds-resolution game is both operational and (intra-city) more tactical with different scaled maps for each.  Unit level is battalion to brigade.  No airpower which has been neutralized in the war but artillery including HIMARS and Russian long-distance glide bombs are present, and there is fortification - albeit flank-able - to mitigate those.

But the added dimension of the game is the expertise levels of the units, their promotion and/or reinforcement/replacement, and the (tragic) human - ergo political - loss factor which can disrupt or even conceivably halt the fighting and the game - a deliverance reversal of the "sudden death" game mechanic, if you will.

There are promote-able conscript and then/also regular army units for both sides.  On the Ukraine side there are the hardcore political Azovs and also, starting in 2023, NATO-trained units of initially unpredictable strength.  On the Russian side, there are promote-able "cost-free" convict/prisoner units and the mercenary Wagners.

Units are hidden until attacking or attacked.

The game could have as many as 6 players: on each side a northern operational player outside the city, the city battle commander, and the southern "outside" operational player, but there will have to be some authority established as to who gets reinforcements/replacements and artillery ammunition use or stockpiling.

The game has relatively simple combat mechanics (albeit having a wave-attack opportunity) and lasts 16 half month turns from the start of October 2022 until the battle's "historical" end ... right now (May 2023).

"Whether the Ukrainians choose to keep it going after having lost the city is ... right now ... problematic.  Hopefully, it will have convinced everyone of the intolerable human cost and futility of continuing the war."

Well, the Ukrainians *have* chosen to resume the battle as part of their offensive and have pushed the Russians back significantly on the northern and southern flanks, so I have added a Continuation Battle of 10 more turns on the Turn Record Track with a suggested order of battle/setup.

—description from the designer

March 14th, 13:37: The perfect moment to play FTW?!

In each round of FTW?!, you try to play your cards so that you preferably keep only one card with a high number. It is possible that you get rid of fewer cards than the other players. As soon as a player has only one card left in their hand, you score plus points for your highest card, but minus points for all additional cards in your hand.

FTW?! has easy rules, but offers a very tricky game experience!

—description from the publisher

In the fast-paced matching game Anarchy Pancakes, each player starts with seven pancake cards that feature various misfit toppings, such as an earthworm, a flaming donut, and a skull wearing a party hat.

On the count of three, players attempt to match their pancake cards' toppings to other players' toppings, forcing them to take the cards and form a "pancake stack". The first player to get rid of all of their cards and shout "Anarchy pancakes!" wins that round and collects a "slab 'o butter". The first player to receive two slabs 'o butter wins.

The cards in Anarchy Pancakes resemble those in Spot it!/Dobble, and Exploding Kittens developed this design in collaboration with Spot it! publisher Zygomatic Games.

The Lunch Room Game is not your typical food fight fun! With 6 squishy tater tots to play for, you will have to be quick so you won't lose your lunch. Players compete to beat the odds in The Lunch Room Game and it's cast of characters, like the mean girls, to be the first player to fill their lunch tray to win the game.

No game board in The Lunch Room Game, each player gets their own mini lunch tray, just like the one at school.

Players draw a card and add it to the matching section in the tray. Cards may switch up the game by making you trade trays, fight over tots, etc.

In Asteroid Miners you lead your crew of fellow belters in mining the asteroid belt, excavating valuable minerals in the cold of space.

Asteroid Miners is a 2-player dice-rolling game where you excavate precious metals using a precision drill and upgradable mining equipment, digging deeper and deeper into a series of asteroids. You will use a dice pool to manipulate your drill components to match the minerals in your current excavation section.

After successful excavations you may sell your minerals to a fluctuating Metal Market, trying to earn more profit than your competitor to win the game.

—description from the publisher

1812: Most of Europe is under Napoleon´s control, and Napoleon is poised to invade Russia and force them to comply with his Continental System and block British trade.  In the face of overwhelming force, the Tsar reluctantly decides to fall back and adopt a scorched earth strategy. Faced by an elusive foe, the French were forced into advancing ever deeper into Russia and all the way to Moscow itself, even though their logistic system was falling apart under the strain.  The infamous retreat back from Moscow was the culmination of the campaign and the turning point of the Napoleonic Wars. Will Napoleon and the hitherto undefeated Grande Armeé crush the Russian army and capture Moscow, or will they be punished for their hubris in the vast expanses of Russia?

1812: The Fateful March is a 2-player game that simulates Napoleons invasion of Russia at the operational level.  It is an easy to play card-driven system that utilizes secret order placement which ensures constant tension and little to no downtime.  As befits the historical campaign, the game features a strong focus on logistic planning and march attrition with a set of simple but highly narrative mechanics.

—description from the publisher

A family-friendly, toilet-themed quirky trick taking game.
The goal is to be the first to claim 400 poop points, or to score the most before one of the draw decks runs out.

Players play poop cards into the play area, alongside toilet cubicles, to accumulate potentially claimable points. Once a poop is 'finished' players race to try to claim the points of that poop in play.

Turns can be based on grabbing points, sharing points or sabotaging other players' options. Let chaos commence!

—description from the designer

Beyond Sector X is a tactical strategy game for one player.

Amidst the vast emptiness of space, you take on the role of a lone explorer, venturing forth on a perilous mission. When a ruthless band of extraterrestrial foes abducts your trusted companion, you must summon all your courage and cunning to infiltrate the enemy mothership, battle the monstrous creatures within, collect all the Energy Crystals throughout, and save your comrade from certain doom.

Use your skills and abilities to navigate through two corridors of the enemy spacecraft. In the first corridor, search for useful items to aid you in your mission. In the second corridor, race against a ticking clock to safely teleport out. Your ultimate goal is to defeat the hostile extraterrestrial beings hiding Beyond Sector X.

Will you emerge victorious, or fall victim to the dangers lurking in the darkness?

—description from the designer

Gloomhaven: Second Edition is a revised and elevated version of the core game of Gloomhaven. This is the culmination of everything we have learned since the initial release of Gloomhaven, including feedback from the community, playtesters, co-designers, and developers.

The world, story, and challenging gameplay are all still the same, but there is a plethora of additional content to explore. Even for those who have played Gloomhaven before, this edition brings new material to the table, with rebalanced and redesigned mercenary classes, items, and scenarios, as well as brand new artwork, newly written narrative and events, updated miniatures, a new faction-based reputation system, and more.

—description from the publisher

La Révolte des Cipayes: 1857-1858 (The Sepoy Mutiny) is a Strategic level board-wargame that uses the same mechanisms as The Belgian Campaign, 1815 (VV124) and The Eagles of the Danube (VV144).

On 10 May 1857, the massacre at the British garrison in Meerut by indigenous troops of the Bengal Presidency erupted and spread to the north of the Indian subcontinent. It took more than two years for the British to regain control in the revolting provinces. Once the rebellion was squashed in 1859, the British Crown was forced to launch a series of major reforms to modify its system of government in India, notably by dissolving the East India Company, to which power had been delegated up until then.
 The game allows you to experience at an Operational level the first two years of conflict during which the main military operations occurred.

You play as a manager trying to help Reach Doll idols get their debut.

In your turn you try to match 3 cards of the same Idol by drawing from one of the 3 decks or the associated queues. By doing that you get a ticket to their concert.

The game ends when a player gets 7 concert tickets.

Exoland is a truly strategic pure balancing game played with calibrated weights.

Players take turns in a race to be rid of their "fleet" of varied weights by playing them onto a balancing gameboard into risk-reward zones.

Causing a crash or being unable to make a play during the game adds a dangerous penalty piece to the fleet.

A concentric "Crash Factor" grid allows players to anticipate the crash risk of any weight placed anywhere.

Playing risky moves away from the center of balance can win advantages or eliminate penalties.

The game ends once a player has deployed all their spaceships and space junk OR when a player collects 7 of the 8 planets.

Play at your own risk!

Spin to discover the joy of everyday life with The Game of Life: Target Edition board game! First, pick a shopping list, filled with items for a specific occasion. Have a list for Pet’s First Birthday? Then head to the Pets Department to get that birthday crown on your list. Players push their red shopping cart movers along the store aisles on the board – in any direction! – to browse Departments and collect all items on their list. Prices vary, so try to nab the cheapest. Along the way, collect Impulse Buy tokens (some things are too good to resist). And draw cards for relatable shopping moments: score items from team members, find deals, and receive texts with shopping curveballs (“R U STILL AT TARGET???? We need toilet paper!!!”). The game ends once everyone reaches Checkout. The player with the most money left wins!

SPIN TO DISCOVER THE JOY OF EVERYDAY LIFE: Ready for a Target Run? Spin the spinner and move that many spaces, gathering everything on your shopping list. Reach Checkout with the most money left to win

8 THEMED TARGET RUNS: Each player’s Target Run shopping list is for a different event, from a Summer Block Party to Family Movie Night. Visit each Department to collect every item on a list

FUNNY FAMILIAR MOMENTS: Draw cards to score deals, get help from team members, receive texts (and shopping requests) from family, and enjoy other relatable moments like “stop and smell ALL the candles”

—description from the publisher

You’re in charge of putting together the best fireworks show.  But no matter what you do you have to get the Grand Finale right. Can you use all the firework cards and end the night with the perfect Grand Finale?

Grand Finale is an 18 card solo only game where you play cards within an 3x3 grid in an attempt to finish the night with a pre-determined display. But be careful, you'll need to play cards so that no two adjacent fireworks are the same size or color. Move played cards up higher in the sky to help fulfill your goal but just make sure your last card played completes your Grand Finale!

Building a kingdom is no easy task - more so if your enemy is trying to occupy the same territory. Build the biggest kingdom by strategically placing your own castles and destroying the enemy's: a single enemy castle is enough to win the game.

Great Kingdom simplifies Go without taking the fun away for experienced players, making it the perfect gateway into the world of Go. It is the first of three games of the game series WIZSTONE, developed by Go grandmaster Lee Sedol.

—description from the publisher

Crossbows & Catapults: Castle Battle is a restoration of Crossbows and Catapults, the 1983 classic game of kinetic warfare. Each player builds their castle, then players take turns using their weapons to fire discs at their opponent's castle, trying to knock over their warrior figures.

This new version features highly engineered weapons and building bricks. The new weapons no longer use rubber bands, replaced by spring-powered and pinch-to-fire technology that ensure reliable velocity and reward player skill. On the building side, castles are constructed using a variety of detailed components to allow for larger, more intricate, and more varied structures.

On your turn, take two actions: Move or Fire. Do them in either order, or do the same one twice. Knock down all the enemy warriors and their general to win!

-description from publisher

In Instant Celebrity, the players are all guessing how the next card revealed from a deck will relate to the previous one. Correct guesses are award points and incorrect guesses grant a loss of points.

Once a player has reached at least 15 points, they have won. The other players continue until a majority of players have won or three of a certain symbol have been revealed from the deck.

There have been vicious falsehoods circulating, such as "Hoshou Marin is in her 30s." This is truly deplorable.
The captain would never lie about his age!
Look at her profile on the official website, it says she is "roughly 17 years old!"
What is needed to counteract the hoax and correct the perceptions of the Internet community is good assertiveness.
Let us, the members gathered here today, compete in our assertions and improve our skills for the coming day.
Now let's get to the question, Hosho Marin is 17 years old!

The numbers 0 to 5 and 8 to 10 appear, but 0, 5, and 10 have different reverse patterns, so the player deduces his or her hand by using that as a clue.
Since the same numbers can be treated as one card, the sexy structure of the game increases both risk and chance at the same time as the number of cards in the hand increases.
If you are the only one left in the hand, you have a chance to score a lot of points, and so on!

In the jungle, everyone knows who the king is, and none of the animals dares to challenge the mighty lion. But on a magical night, 6 amulets were created. Now the kingdom can belong to anyone!

Objective: Win consecutive battles until reaching 12 points, challenging opponents with "The Kingdom is Mine!" in each battle.

There are six different types of animals, each one stronger than the previous one. All animals have 4 levels. So a level 3 snake defeats a level 2 snake but loses to a level 1 lion.

In each round, a new amulet will be opened indicating which animal will be the trump of the round. This animal will win against any other, regardless of their ranking. The round is worth as many points as the number of players who decide to compete in it, with an additional point if all players participate. The winner is the first player to reach 20 points.

Spend your money, trying to get sets of the same-colour-cube for maximum points. But the winning bid will go to the current auctioneer, who has paid for that privilege!

Do you like struggling to work out how much something is worth?

Do you like the tension of spending money, hoping to make a profit?

Do you like the possibility of losing a game on the first turn?

Alternating between blind auctions (to become the auctioneer) and open English auctions (to buy the cubes).

—description from the designer

Have you ever thought of becoming the greatest builder of the 7th century's most important kingdom? Welcome to Medang, a Hindu-Buddhist civilisation from the Java island, where you'll have to lead one of its five major dynasties and build a temple.

You'll be part of the Samara, the Dharmasetu, the Dharanindra, the Panangkaran or the Rakai dynasty and battle to take control of the temple. Be smart and develop a good strategy because you'll have to collaborate to build the temple, but only the dynasty that places the most tiles will be declared the winner.

In turns, you'll place the tiles to build the temple, activating their special skills if you choose to. All the players will have access to a tile market to replace those that you use to build the temple.

—description from the publisher

In The Smurfs: Hidden Village, players are Smurfs who are tasked with rebuilding the mushroom village from scratch following the evil sorcerer Gargamel's latest scheme. To succeed, you need to work together as a team, collecting resources, building inventions, and locating missing Smurfs to help rebuild mushroom houses. Each Smurf has a unique set of skills that you must use strategically to outsmart Gargamel and his cat Azrael.

The adorable puppies are piled up, and you want your puppy at the top!

Each player has a secret puppy. Over the course of the game, players will move various puppies up and down through the pile. Try to figure out your opponent's puppies and keep them lower in the pile while you try to move your secret puppy to the top.

When the PICK A WINNER card is drawn, the top dog wins!

—description from the publisher

Oh, no! The greatest balloons party of all time was about to start when, all of a sudden, the balloons got mixed up. You and your friends are in charge of selecting the balloons that better fit the party.

Balloons! is a kids game where you'll have to be the quickest collecting balloon cards in order to win. Everyone plays simultaneously, so laughter and craziness are a given!

This game is adapted to people with visual impairments, as all the balloons have unique colours and shapes.

—description from the publisher

Capital Horse is a trivia game in which 6 randomly chosen Japanese prefectures are running as the horses in a race.  Each race, a category is chosen (such as size of prefecture or population), and the players make up to 3 wagers from 7 different options. Accurate wagers give a player points based upon the rankings of the prefectures.
